Text.Value: *It's the scent of Avernus.*
*... fire. You hear laughter. You smell brimstone.*
I've had a solution in mind for a while now, it just took me some time to... set it in motion.
Stop that! How dare you...
That's it - I won't take more of your time this lovely evening. Rest well.
Up to tricks, are we?
A word, if you please.
Not at all.
Remember how I told you I was in dire need of magical artefacts to absorb?
Stop that! How dare you - again...
Forget whatever it was you saw. It's all beyond you now anyway.
No more than what I had to - and that's all I'll say on the matter.
We'll let all this rest for now, but it will be addressed again later.
Not really, no.
Much later. If ever.
I don't follow. This seems awfully sudden.
Good to know - and good night.
Clearly the matter has hardly been a priority of yours, but even so, you can consider it closed.
In my mind, you are quite blind.
Suit yourself. Like I said: I no longer require your assistance.
I don't think I want you around any longer.
You too, Gale.
No matter. All you see is what I want you to see.
*Mocking words drift back to you. 'This is the House of Hope.'*
Up to old tricks again, are we?
Farewell.
*You flutter through his mind like a bat through the night and you see...*
Good night.
Gale, what did you do?
*... nothing but darkness.*
Something's off. Try to connect with Gale without him noticing.
I no longer require assistance - neither yours, nor that of artefacts.
Care to tell me why?

Synopsis: Gale has asked the player for magical items to consume, but he’s received none. He now informs the player they’re no longer needed. It’s a tense scene because despite multiple demands the player did nothing to help Gale, and Gale is not forthcoming with information about the nature of the solution he found. It will later turn out that he made a deal with a devil.
